abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Urban Flood
            Prevention and Drainage Project is to reduce the city of
            Buenos Aires vulnerability to flooding through the
            improvement of the level of protection of its drainage
            system and the implementation of a risk management program.
            The project would focus on the issue of risk identification
            and reduction through prevention, mitigation, and education.
            The closing date extension is necessary to: 1) complete the
            ongoing works in the tunnels and secondary drainage network;
            2) initiate and complete non-structural measures agreed in
            the Project Appraisal Document (PAD); and 3) allow for the
            orderly completion of the project and closing of the loan.
            The delay in project implementation is due to a combination
            of the delay of sixteen months in project effectiveness; and
            a lengthened process for procuring the large and complex
            tunnel works contract under international competitive
            bidding. The tunneling works are progressing at an optimum
            pace and are expected to reach 50 percent completion by the
            end of 2010.
